name: Enterprise Ransomware Attack Simulation
description: Simulating a full ransomware attack against an enterprise environment, from initial compromise to recovery.

steps.title: Suspicious Email
steps.description: An employee receives an email from 'admin@corp-support.io' asking them to review an invoice attachment. What should you advise?
options: Open it only if it's from someone they know
Forward it to IT and avoid opening
Click to see if antivirus blocks it

steps.title: Macro Execution
steps.description: The user opens the attachment and enables macros. EDR flags unusual behavior. What’s your immediate response?
options: Shut down the machine remotely
Start scanning other user inboxes
Isolate the endpoint and pull memory for analysis

steps.title: Persistence Established
steps.description: You discover the attacker installed a scheduled task and registry run key. What’s your next step?
options: Delete the files and reboot
Investigate lateral movement indicators
Wipe the device

steps.title: Lateral Movement
steps.description: There are signs of credential dumping via LSASS. How should you respond?
options: Restart the affected machine
Initiate a domain-wide credential reset
Disable antivirus temporarily for deeper forensics

steps.title: Domain Controller Access
steps.description: Anomalous behavior is detected on a domain controller. What’s your priority action?
options: Run gpupdate /force to reapply policy
Remove the DC from the network and alert IR
Check user group memberships

steps.title: Payload Execution
steps.description: Encrypted files and a ransom note appear across endpoints. What’s your organization’s first move?
options: Pay the ransom to recover operations
Engage legal, IR, and forensics immediately
Delete the ransomware files manually

steps.title: Communication Strategy
steps.description: Leadership wants to inform the public. What’s the recommended step?
options: Make a social media post immediately
Work with legal and PR to draft an official statement
Send an internal email blaming the user

steps.title: Backup & Restoration
steps.description: You identify unaffected offline backups. What’s the best practice before restoring systems?
options: Format all drives and begin restore
Ensure network is cleaned and threat is eradicated
Restore all systems in parallel for speed

steps.title: Regulatory Reporting
steps.description: Which agency must you notify if customer data was affected and you’re in the U.S.?
options: CISA or local FBI field office
Only your ISP
OSHA

steps.title: Post-Incident Hardening
steps.description: Which control best reduces the impact of a future ransomware event?
options: Disable email access
Apply network segmentation and EDR baselining
Enforce password changes every 7 days
